Dead by Daylight ist an sich ein wirklich cooles und aufregendes Spiel. Mit Freunden zusammen DBD zu spielen, macht bedeutend mehr SpaÃŸ als alleine. NatÃ¼rlich ist das Spiel noch ausbaufÃ¤hig und hat hier und da einige Bugs, jedoch kann man mit diesen gut leben. Ein kleiner Kritikpunkt ist, dass die Hitbox von dem Killer wirklich zu groÃŸzÃ¼gig ist und man oft getroffen wird, wo man hÃ¤tte gar nicht mehr getroffen werden kÃ¶nnen. Jedoch ist im groÃŸen und ganzen Dead by Daylight ein fesselndes Spiel und man schaut immer wieder aufs neue gerne rein, ich persÃ¶nlich finde es auch gut gelungen, dass man mehrere Charakter hat und diese individuell durch Perks an seinen Spielstil anpassen kann. Auswahl bietet DBD garantiert :)

Dead by daylight is an amazing game the keeps me coming back to it time and time again. Very few other games like it! With great graphics, endless builds, wonderful maps, fun gameplay, and ability to play with and against friends, this game is hard to put down. Dead by daylight is also free now I believe on epic games. Not to mention it has in app purchases but is definitely not pay to win. For sure one of my favs. 10/10!

There are a lot of things you can get by playing this game ,both good and bad. But by playing this game a lot you will notice problems that this game has and i want to express those problems i believe are making me not recommend this game so that maybe something in the future will change. First of all the game most of the time is not fair. Perks in this game have a big impact on the outcome of every match and some specific perks have such a big impact that i believe are straight up over powered. So if you just started and don't have those perks unlocked yet ,you might have a difficult time because most of the time ,you will go against killers or survivors that will use them. Secondly ,i think the developers make a lot of questionable decisions. Don't get the wrong idea ,i have nothing against the devs and i appreciate their work and the content that they bring in this game ,but some of their decisions i do not understand. One example of this is them bringing SBMM (Skill Based Match Making) in the game which for a lot of balance reasons does not fit into a game like Dead By Daylight ,and despite a lot of people complaining about it ,they still have it (during the time i wrote this review). Lastly ,i do not have anything against the community of this game but from my experience ,a lot of them want you to play in a specific way and i do not like that at all. You are trying to play a game and you will have other players trying to shame you for every plan you put into action which in my opinion is not healthy for the game. I love this game ,its really interesting and fun sometimes and because of that i wanted to make this review. I want to see this game become better and i want the problems of this game to be addressed and fixed.

Homemade Brownie Recipe Ingredients
Back to Michelleâ€™s recipe for brownies! In order for it to turn out like (aka better than) the boxed mix, Michelle uses granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, salt, and chocolate chips. Then, she adds these key ingredients:

2 eggs + water â€“ Michelle uses a bit of water with the eggs to achieve the moist, gooey texture of boxed mix brownies without any commercial emulsifiers. And because this recipe doesnâ€™t contain any baking powder, eggs are essential for helping the brownies puff up in the oven.
Powdered sugar â€“ The trick to making homemade brownies that are just like ones from a box! Powdered sugar contains cornstarch, which helps thicken the batter without the chemical additives youâ€™d find in a mix.
Unsweetened cocoa powder â€“ Michelle recommends using Hersheyâ€™s Special Dark Dutch-processed cocoa powder (I used Whole Foodsâ€™ 365 Cocoa Powder). Make sure to sift it if itâ€™s lumpy!
Oil â€“ While many recipes for brownies use unsalted butter, Michelleâ€™s calls for canola oil, just like the boxed mix. I use olive oil because itâ€™s what I keep on hand, and I love the rich flavor.
Vanilla Extract â€“ 1/2 teaspoon vanilla really amps up the chocolate flavor.
Very good game, though I wish Behaviour was actually serious about balancing the game at high level play. Playing against 3k hour SWF groups is a joke.

This game is extremely unbalanced. Killers have a hard time competing against survivors since it's sided towards them. As of 28/02/22, I finally reached Iridescent 1 and I feel like I've wasted so much time going through the struggle of getting beat up by survivors. Most of the matches will be gen rushers, which is really hard to counter, and there will be times where a subtle/obvious hacker can pop up. The developers don't care too much about their game's main core mechanics and instead will continue to add more content w/out ever fixing much in the slightest. They're so out of touch with the community. They even have Cenobite in the game where the money you contributed to purchasing him will support an NFT company. The MMR system is broken to all hell and back, pairing you up against absolute bots, in which if you had a kind heart, would probably let them win, or you can face up against the most try hard players. The game may have a chance of becoming better in the future, but for the time being, don't waste your money on this mediocrity.
